page.title: 01SUMMARY OF AREA
page.content: The area lies at the western end of the Poldens and stretches southwards over the Somerset Levels. There are three villages within the square, Woolavington, Cossington and Bawdrip. The only part of Woolavington included is a new estate built on the outskirts of the village. Cossington and Bawdrip have changed little in size for many years. Until recent years the levels were considered wasteland but once drained became valuable farmland.The Poldens since Roman times have been used as a travel route to the port of Dunball.
